body_html:
You're, right! I managed to write x.data twice, which makes the test pass every time.
Changing the first x → out shows that my original fix was wrong (as x.data != out.data).
I've changed it to memoryview(x).tobytes(), which should work with both Python 2 and 3.
body_text:
You're, right! I managed to write x.data twice, which makes the test pass every time.
Changing the first x → out shows that my original fix was wrong (as x.data != out.data).
I've changed it to memoryview(x).tobytes(), which should work with both Python 2 and 3.
body:
You're, right! I managed to write `x.data` twice, which makes the test pass every time.
Changing the first x → out shows that my original fix was wrong (as `x.data != out.data`).
I've changed it to `memoryview(x).tobytes()`, which should work with both Python 2 and 3.
